title: Error when labeling extracted frames, not saved
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**

Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut2


**Describe the problem**
Trying to demo my own data, and when I get to "Label the extracted frames" I am able to label them, but the labeled images does not get saved. 

This is the error I get:
```
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
/home/poop/anaconda3/envs/DeepLabCut2/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/core/formatters.py in __call__(self, obj)
    303                 pass
    304             else:
--> 305                 return printer(obj)
    306             # Finally look for special method names
    307             method = get_real_method(obj, self.print_method)

/home/poop/anaconda3/envs/DeepLabCut2/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/core/pylabtools.py in <lambda>(fig)
    237 
    238     if 'png' in formats:
--> 239         png_formatter.for_type(Figure, lambda fig: print_figure(fig, 'png', **kwargs))
    240     if 'retina' in formats or 'png2x' in formats:
    241         png_formatter.for_type(Figure, lambda fig: retina_figure(fig, **kwargs))

/home/poop/anaconda3/envs/DeepLabCut2/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/core/pylabtools.py in print_figure(fig, fmt, bbox_inches, **kwargs)
    121 
    122     bytes_io = BytesIO()
--> 123     fig.canvas.print_figure(bytes_io, **kw)
    124     data = bytes_io.getvalue()
    125     if fmt == 'svg':

/home/poop/anaconda3/envs/DeepLabCut2/lib/python3.6/site-packages/matplotlib/backends/backend_wx.py in print_figure(self, filename, *args, **kwargs)
    831         # determining things like bounding boxes.
    832         if self._isDrawn:
--> 833             self.draw()
    834 
    835     def _onPaint(self, evt):

/home/poop/anaconda3/envs/DeepLabCut2/lib/python3.6/site-packages/matplotlib/backends/backend_wxagg.py in draw(self, drawDC)
     39         self.bitmap = _convert_agg_to_wx_bitmap(self.get_renderer(), None)
     40         self._isDrawn = True
---> 41         self.gui_repaint(drawDC=drawDC, origin='WXAgg')
     42 
     43     def blit(self, bbox=None):

/home/poop/anaconda3/envs/DeepLabCut2/lib/python3.6/site-packages/matplotlib/backends/backend_wx.py in gui_repaint(self, drawDC, origin)
    799         """
    800         DEBUG_MSG("gui_repaint()", 1, self)
--> 801         if self.IsShownOnScreen():
    802             if not drawDC:
    803                 # not called from OnPaint use a ClientDC

RuntimeError: wrapped C/C++ object of type FigureCanvasWxAgg has been deleted

<Figure size 1073x844 with 2 Axes>
```

The program creates a .csv and.h5 file in the correct folder with the extracted frames, but it seems like the labeled frames gets immediately deleted. I thought it might have to do with the size of the pictures, but the frames themselves are smaller than the 850x850 you mention at this step. Is there a way to fix this issue?

Thank you for all the work and help given, so far this tool seems awesome!
